userRules
Class ExampleAverage

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.rules.RuleActions
      cellularAutomata.rules.Rule
          cellularAutomata.rules.templates.RealVectorRuleTemplate
              userRules.ExampleAverage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class ExampleAverage
extends RealVectorRuleTemplate

Finds the average of a cell and all of its neighbors. Each cell has a real (floating point) value assigned.
This rather boring class was primarily written as an example of extending the RealVectorRuleTemplate class. Note this class needed each cell to store a single real value. In other words, this class needed each cell to store an array of length 1. So the implementation of the getVectorLength() method returns 1. If we had desired a different graphical display, the setView() method from the parent could have been called (in the constructor). See the ColorAverage class for an example of this. We could have also restricted the lattices for which this rule works by overriding the getCompatibleLattices (again see the ColorAverage class).
This same class could have been written by extending the Rule class, but that would have required additional work. The RealVectorRuleTemplate and other "RuleTemplate" classes take care of many details (at the loss of some flexibility).

Author:
David Bahr

Method Detail

doubleVectorRule

public double[] doubleVectorRule(double[] cellArray,
                                 double[][] neighborArrays,
                                 int generation)
Finds the average value of a cell and all of its neighbors.

Specified by:
doubleVectorRule in class RealVectorRuleTemplate
Parameters:
cellArray - The current value of the cell being updated. The value is a double array.
neighborArrays - The current values of each neighbor. The values are double arrays. In other words, the first index is the number of the neighbor, and the second index is the array position for the that neighbor's array. By convention the neighbors' geometry should be indexed clockwise starting to the northwest of the cell.
generation - The current generation of the CA.
Returns:
A new state for the cell. Each element of the array must be between the values provided by getMinimumPermissibleValue() and getMaximumPermissibleValue().
See Also:
RealVectorRuleTemplate.doubleVectorRule( double[], double[][], int)

getMaximumPermissibleValue

public double getMaximumPermissibleValue()
Gets the maximum permissible value for each element of the vector. Do not recommend using Double.MAX_VALUE unless your code very carefully checks for instances of Infinity.
This method is used by the RealVectorRuleTemplate class to properly construct a RealValuedVectorState.

Specified by:
getMaximumPermissibleValue in class RealVectorRuleTemplate
Returns:
The maximum permissible value.
See Also:
RealVectorRuleTemplate.getMaximumPermissibleValue()

getToolTipDescription

public java.lang.String getToolTipDescription()
A brief description (written in HTML) that describes this rule. The description will be displayed as a tooltip. Using html permits line breaks, font colors, etcetera, as described in HTML resources. Regular line breaks will not work.

Specified by:
getToolTipDescription in class Rule
Returns:
An HTML string describing this rule.
See Also:

getVectorLength

public int getVectorLength()
Gets the length of the vectors (arrays) that will be used by the Rule. The length must be the same for all cells.

Specified by:
getVectorLength in class RealVectorRuleTemplate
Returns:
The length of the vector stored by each cell.
